channel.title: VA News Releases
channel.description: News Releases from the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs.

item.title: VA strengthens care for Veterans impacted by intimate partner violence and sexual assault
item.description: The Department of Veterans Affairs recently initiated a pilot program to improve services for Veterans who have experienced or are experiencing intimate partner violence or sexual assault.

item.title: 2021 Under Secretary for Health's Robert L. Jesse Award recognizes VA boundary-breaking innovations
item.description: The Department of Veterans Affairs honored three innovative health care practices and their creators late October with the Robert L. Jesse Award for Excellence in Innovation.

item.title: VA advances Electronic Health Record Modernization program
item.description: The Department of Veterans Affairs announced today its updated plan to move forward with its systemwide Electronic Health Record Modernization program.

item.title: VA statement on GPO printing and mailing delay
item.description: Due to supply chain and staffing shortages, the vendor contracted by the Government Publishing Office to provide printing services for the Department of Veterans Affairs is experiencing delays in printing and mailing notification letters to Veterans and claimants. The disruption may impact the ability of some claimants to meet required deadlines via written correspondence with VA.

item.title: VA and Indian Health Service broaden scope to serve American Indian and Alaska Native Veterans
item.description: The Department of Veterans Affairs and the Indian Health Service renewed a partnership, Oct. 1, to help the country's nearly 145,000 American Indian and Alaska Native Veterans overcome health care access barriers.

item.title: Smoking rates steadily trend down among Veterans receiving VA care
item.description: In conjunction with the Great American Smokeout observed Nov. 18, the Department of Veterans Affairs is encouraging Veterans to talk to their health care providers about smoking cessation programs to help them quit, as cigarette use continues to decline nationwide.

item.title: VA helps women Veteran entrepreneurs power up
item.description: The Department of Veterans Affairs, in collaboration with the PenFed Foundation, helped three women-owned small businesses earn business development grants used to support their growing companies in the economic marketplace.
